brainly_data.question:
Which is an example of a secondary source for a report on the anatomy and physiology of a bee? 
Select one:

a video of bees shot over time using a video camera

a written description of the report writer’s observations of bees

a clear hive that allows an observer to watch bees collect and store honey

a diagram of a bee’s anatomy found in a textbook
brainly_data.subject: English

all_answers.question:
Which is an example of a secondary source for a report on the anatomy and physiology of a bee? 
Select one:

a video of bees shot over time using a video camera

a written description of the report writer’s observations of bees

a clear hive that allows an observer to watch bees collect and store honey

a diagram of a bee’s anatomy found in a textbook
all_answers.subject: English
all_answers.text:
A diagram of a bee's anatomy found in a textbook

secondary sources are sources that are after the fact. the first three choices are live action or current sources about the event that is happening (primary sources). 
hope this helped :)
